item.title: School Boards in the metro area are facing the brunt of angry...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

School Boards in the metro area are facing the brunt of angry parents due to the words of Governor Polis saying he thinks K-5 should be in school.

We have had parents call us “child abusers” because their students aren’t able to be in the classroom.

I am calling on the Governor to correct this statement with saying he believes in local control and that school districts should make their own decisions.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: We have tried every option available and we would love to have...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

We have tried every option available and we would love to have our students back in schools and environments for staff to feel safe in, but we can no longer do that.

Governor Polis and Mayor Hancock can give their opinions on how our students should learn, but they have NOT offered resources or staff to keep our buildings open.

Due to staffing issues we can not operate properly as a district. This needs to be a wake up call for all of Denver.

...

I hope that this special session coming up will provide a stimulus to families that are losing wages while being forced to stay home with their kids.

See MoreSuperintendent Susana Cordova said the increasing spread of COVID is causing "severe staffing shortages."

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver to shift remaining in-person students to online learning after Thanksgiving

Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽

Chalkbeat Colorado

“It’s important our youth don’t fall for the illusion, the trap of thinking we must live all of our lives in hands up, don’t shoot,” said Sharif El-Mekki, found...er and chief executive officer of The Center for Black Educator Development. “But rather our ancestors have always taught us to take our resistance to these unjust systems.”

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I am disappointed in both Governor Polis and Mayor Hancock for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I am disappointed in both Governor Polis and Mayor Hancock for making public statements about K-5 education without consulting local school boards.

We should not have to find out “recommendations” from state and city leaders at press conferences.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Families need to be compensated if they’re keeping children at...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Families need to be compensated if they’re keeping children at home. The $375 in unemployment benefits from Governor Polis is nice, but is a drop in the bucket.

Today I asked our district to find us a path to put pressure on the city and state to find ways to support our families in this crisis.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver Public Schools has served 2,000,000 meals since the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools has served 2,000,000 meals since the pandemic started in March.
item.author: Tay Anderson

Welp that’s it folks, I can officially solve the budget crisis in DPS.

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Dear DPS Community, By now you may have heard the bittersweet...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Dear DPS Community,
By now you may have heard the bittersweet announcement about Superintendent Susana Cordova’s departure. After over 30 years in DPS, she has accepted a position in Dallas Independent School District as the Deputy Superintendent of Leading and Learning. We are excited for her to pursue this new opportunity in Dallas. We will miss her, and our community will miss her.

We are so grateful to Susana for the work that she has done for DPS in her 31-year career as...

Continue Reading
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: IMPORTANT: ﻿Our schools are facing severe staffing shortages,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

IMPORTANT: ﻿Our schools are facing severe staffing shortages, which is impacting our ability to keep schools open. Families can help support our schools in a few ways:

Become a guest teacher: Support our schools as a guest teacher or substitute paraprofessional. https://careers.dpsk12.org/…/teach-at-…/substitute-teaching/

Work for DPS: See all of our DPS job openings here. http://tiny.cc/dpsjobs

...

Volunteer: DPS values the help of volunteers who wish to support and there may be opportunities for parents and community members to volunteer during outdoor activities at our schools. For more information, email Brenda_Vasquez@dpsk12.org.

See More

dpsjobboard.dpsk12.org

dpsjobboard.dpsk12.org
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: There will be continuity in Denver Public Schools.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

There will be continuity in Denver Public Schools.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I don’t understand how we are seeing cases rise in Denver and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I don’t understand how we are seeing cases rise in Denver and Bronco games are being prioritized over our students education.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I support another “stay at home” order. The last time they...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I support another “stay at home” order. The last time they did that we saw cases drop dramatically.

With that we need to include childcare for essential workers, hero pay (including educators that are still teaching in schools), rent and eviction freeze, stoping homeless sweeps and paid family leave.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Come January 2021 our students and educators need to have a safe...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Come January 2021 our students and educators need to have a safe plan to return to school.

It’s time for us to acknowledge that COVID will be around for the foreseeable future, but it’s also time for us to begin a plan that follows the science AND welcomes our students back to schools.

I will be working with my colleagues on a plan that we can get in the hands of #TeamDPS on what our future looks like moving forward in the coming weeks.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Regardless of politics, I hope that we can be able to model for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Regardless of politics, I hope that we can be able to model for our future generations that bullying and threats are not who we are as a society.

As someone who has struggled with mental health issues and battled suicidal thoughts as a teenager, I am yet again reminded that we have a lot of work to do to support our communities.

Hate has no place in our communities, I not only will pray for this individual I will begin to look at ways to improve mental health supports for students and staff in Denver Public Schools.

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
